http.title: Holiday Villa, Apartments with Spa, heated Infinity Pool in le Marche Italy – Borgo Tranquillo
http.html:
Borgo Tranquillo - Holiday Villa, Apartments & Spa le Marche Italy

Borgo Tranquillo features a luxury Holiday Villa, Apartments & Spa in le Marche, Italy. Four 88 m2 apartments and one 150 m2 villa. Clubhouse & Spa with Sauna, Hammam and a large heated black infinity pool in a spectacular hilltop setting. Perfect for a relaxing break.

We Are
Click to find out more

We Are

Borgo Tranquillio Design Resort offers peace and tranquillity in a breathtaking 360 degree hill top setting. The Estate has been beautifully restored by internationally renowned designer Frank Andrew together with a team of local architects and craftsmen.

The lifestyle at Borgo Tranquillo is easy and relaxed and the approach to the design one of discreet modernity. The architecture has been restored in the traditional manner with interiors treated in a more contemporary loft-style.

Borgo Tranquillo offers four self catering 88 sqm apartments and one 150sqm Villa. Borgo Tranquillo also boast a communal Clubhouse & Spa, containing a large lounge with free bar, library, open fire place, Sauna, Hamman, indoor relaxation area as well as a stunning black infinity pool. With a maximum of twelve guests everyone can be assured of a peaceful and relaxing stay.
Email Us

About Us
Click to find out more

About Us

After years of working in high-powered jobs in London and abroad, we, Frank (who ran an internationally renowned design company for 25+ years) and Ariane (senior manager at Bloomberg) decided to look for a change of lifestyle.

We had always loved Italy and initially thought of moving to Tuscany, but discovered Tuscany’s less well known neighbour Le Marche.

A visit in autumn of 2002 sealed our fate. We immediately fell in love with the countryside and the warmth of the people and by summer 2003 were the new owners of a cluster of houses ( a ‘borgo’ or hamlet) in a breathtaking position just outside Arcevia, Le Marche.

Once we got planning permission our team of local builders worked with passion and great craftsmanship for over three and a half years to complete Borgo Tranquillo.

We were keen that the interiors should be a generous size and be luxuriously appointed in a contemporary style, we enjoy the juxtaposition of the traditional exteriors and modern interiors. This extends to outside where the minimalist gardens blend with the breathtaking hilltop setting. We created the Clubhouse and Spa so that the Borgo would have a heart.

Together with Tintin, our Vizsla, we look forward to welcoming you at Borgo Tranquillo.

Villa
Click to find out more

Villa

The two bedroom/bathroom 150 sqm villa is approached by its own private hedged gardens with lawns, terraces and a well.

The front door opens to a generous hall with spectacular timber and concrete staircase.

Ground floor:
A large timber beamed king size bedroom with French windows leading into your private garden. Walk-in dressing area and en-suite shower room with WC, bidet and large wet-room shower.

Timber beamed kitchen/dining room with white marble Italian designer kitchen, French windows lead onto private garden and outdoor dining area. Dining area seats six.

First floor:
Large timber beamed king size or twin bedroom with panoramic views, free standing wardrobe and en-suite bathroom, featuring WC, bidet, two sinks, double ended bath.

Living room with open fire, sofas, French windows onto your own private balcony.

Apartment 1

East facing 88 sqm 1 bedroom high ceiling apartment at ground floor level with private terrace. The apartment is approached via landscaped lavender gardens. One enters from the private terrace with outdoor dining/lounging facilities into a large open plan living/kitchen area. The living room features wood burning stove, large sofas, dining area seating for four people and fully integrated marble kitchen.

A small corridor leads from the living area into the bedroom with king size bed and en suite bathroom. The bathroom is fitted with WC, bidet, wet-room shower area and large double ended bath.

(VAT, Gas, Water, Electricity, Heating, Bed linen (changed weekly) Bath- and Pool Towels (changed twice a week) Firewood, Barbeques, Mountain Bikes, Free Bar, Nespresso coffee, DVD and book library, when in season, fresh fruit and vegetables from the gardens, use of Swimming Pool now heated, Sauna, Hammam (Turkish Steam Room), and of course the end cleaning.

This was our first family holiday so we really hoped Borgo Tranquillo would deliver – and it completely exceeded our expectations!!! the apartment was so styles, well equipped and had ore than enough space for our family of four. Borgo Perfecto

We have stayed with our two young children at Borgo Tranquillo for a couple of weeks every summer for the last six years, and we can honestly say that the Borgo is an extraordinary, delightful, and searingly beautiful haven and hideaway, hidden away up in the still and rolling hills near Arcevia in the yet-to-be-discovered Le Marche region of Italy. The brilliant, hospitable and super-friendly owners Frank and Ariane set the tone through their endless little touches, like leaving trays of warm, yummy, just-baked fragrant madelaines out in the clubhouse for guests to enjoy at tea time, or a rustic basket of home-grown Datterini tomatoes, courgettes and shiny aubergines for guests to help-themselves to. Stunning and utterly unspoilt views of a hidden valley from the architect-designed infinity pool are enchanting and truly world-class, and their are further on-site divertimenti, such as investigating the snug blond-wood Scandinavian-style sauna and the hammam steam room, or exploring the tranquil ‘Sylvie’ blackberry trail, on the far side of the grounds. The excellently tended grounds and the ultra-swish Modern interior lines and design make the Borgo Tranquillo a truly unbelievable one off destination. We love it! Alex, Su, Sylvie and Amelie, London, August 2013

A perfect place to stay in Italy

This was our second stay at Borgo Tranquillo and it certainly will not be our last! Having holidayed in Italy for over fifteen years, we have found our share of wonderful places to stay in Tuscany, Umbria and now the Marches. But nowhere have we found the wonderful combination of location, apartment, facilities and – above everything else – ambience that go into making the Borgo the perfect place to stay.  There are so many things that make this a very special place. The apartments are spacious, modern and cool, with beautiful bathrooms and well equipped kitchen areas. Not only do they look wonderful but everything works – first time! The infinity pool is a fabulous place to relax, or swim, while the views over the surrounding countryside are stunning, and the path round the boundary of the property provides a walk just long enough to qualify as ‘exercise’. The club house , is a brilliant idea, providing a further place to relax or socialise with other guests. However the Borgo would not be the same without Frank and Ariane, whose friendly but discreet presence makes staying at the Borgo a very much more personal experience than the term ‘self catering’ suggests.  For harmonious surroundings and tranquility, complemented by a warm welcome and beautiful grounds, it would be very hard to find a better place to pass a week – or two – or three! Elisabeth and Dennis, Edinburgh, July 2013

Borgo tranquillo offre pace e tranquillità alla sommità di una collina marchigiana con una vista mozzafiato a 360°. Una fantastica piscina aperta 24 ore su 24,un centro benessere,ampio salone con biblioteca, camino, sauna, bagno turco. L’appartamento molto grande e arredato in stile moderno è ben equipaggiato in cucina per la preparazione di cenette e aperitivi. Con un massimo di 12 ospiti (e noi unici e in assoluto seconda coppia italiana mai ospitata) il relax e’ garantito e un po’ ci e’ sembrato di essere all’estero. I proprietari Frank e Ariane sono cordialissimi,ci hanno accolto con un bicchiere di vino e con una bottiglia gia’ fresca in frigor!!!! Ogni giorno lasciavano torte o verdure fresche appena colte dal loro orto per gli ospiti!!!Due persone adorabili come il loro bellissimo cane TinTin. Anche il nostro cane(Maya)ha gradito scorrazzare liberamente ogni giorno per quella fantastica collina!!! Insomma una vacanza di totale relax in cui ci siamo sentiti come a casa e coccolati dal paesaggio meraviglioso.Veramente un posto da sogno!!! Piece of Haven

Our stays at Borgo Tranquillo have been like small delightful “pockets of tranquility”. Let’s put it this way: the summer is just not the same without….. Even our children (4 and 6 yrs) feel there are no perfect summer without our annual week in paradise 🙂 Next summer we will return for our fourth time.   The photos gives the impression of a design resort placed in the most perfect, spectacular surroundings. It is just that LIVE it feels a thousand times better…..   The design of the resort, the size of apartments and house, are perfect, and you can either relax and chill or do a run on a charming path around the large, green area. The infinity pool, pool house and surroundings areas are friendly both for young and old, and it is easy to friend up with your neighbor. There are ALWAYS a vacant nice sunbed, Fatboy or/and umbrella waiting. The charm is that only 6 couples/families can stay at once. Luxury!  Well worth to mention is also the steam room/hammam in the pool house, always accessible. You have the feeling of being truly privileged when at Borgo Tranquillo.  This part of Italy (too) feels like an “unexplored gem”. A lot to offer, and we can highly recommend both excursions to the caves and nearby cities, all with great historical interest. The nearby restaurants are well worth a visit too. With the informative welcome-book you can read small reviews before exploring the area.   But what really keep us coming back year after year, are Ariane and Frank and their unbelievable generosity and hospitality. They are the most loving and devoted hosts you can ever dream of. They manage their role perfectly, without being too involved. They balance this fine line extremely well!   You are always greeted with a smile – and if you miss anything (hardly, as everything is already thought of way before your arrival), they both help out! With a smile. ALWAYS!  Arianes home baked cakes suddenly appearing in the pool house – or the freshly picked tomatoes & grenes – are examples of small surprises awaiting during the stay!  The new family member, the one and only Tintin – their gorgeous dog– is greatly missed. Our two little ones can almost not wait for next summer`s cuddling.   Thank you again! See you again in July!
The Bentzens, Oslo, July 2012

Heaven on Earth

The Perfect Hideaway

What might have been a claustrophobic 2 weeks experience in any regular hotel room actually turned into a extremely relaxing and cosy wellness holiday. The apartments extremely well equipped and we took advatage of the fire place, the professional kitchen and Frank’s huge DVD-library.
We can’t wait to come back next year with better weather to finally use all the facilities like the sensational pool and to explore more of the beautiful Marche. The region is quite a discovery to us and we are still enjoying the red and white wine we brought home from some of the nearby wineries.

Perfection!

We stayed at Borgo Tranquillo for two weeks this summer and can’t wait to return! From the stunning scenery, to the beautiful apartment – everything was absolutely perfect; Frank and Ariane are wonderful hosts and have created something truly special here.
The location is quite simply stunning! We spent many days lounging by the amazing infinity pool, enjoying the panoramic views of the mountains and valleys. It is only about an hour away from the coast and Ancona airport, but it strikes the perfect balance of seclusion and privacy, without feeling isolated. Nearby Arcevia, a lovely hilltop town, also has everything you need – great butchers/bakers/small supermarket.
The apartment itself was exactly what we were looking for: beautifully designed and styled, incredibly well equipped, and very spacious. It is not a typical self-catering property, more like something you’d actually want to live in!
Although the properties are self-catering, we were very well looked after by Frank and Ariane. On arrival, we were met with a very warm welcome and a glass of wine in the clubhouse – a great start to the holiday! They really are the perfect hosts – welcoming, friendly, helpful, and very knowledgeable about the region. Their personal touches (like the card in the apartment) and incredible attention to detail really make the whole Borgo Tranquillo experience very special indeed.
We had a fantastic holiday – our best, in fact! We’re already looking at dates for next year and, as I said at the start of the review, can’t wait to go back! If you’re looking for a touch of luxury, total relaxation and spectacular surroundings, then I don’t think there is anywhere better.
Nicola & Johnathan, Yorkshire, July 2009

Stylish rural haven!

Borgo Tranquillo really is impeccable as a rental. The owners, Frank and Ariane, have pulled off the difficult trick of creating a place that is both extremely stylish and immaculately thought out in every detail and relaxed and easy-going as a place to stay. The surrounding area is very beautiful and unspoilt and will appeal to anyone who likes Tuscany and Umbria, but wants somewhere less touristy, especially in summer. The nearest town, Arcevia, is delightful, and there are plenty of other interesting small towns and villages around to explore (Jesi, Fabriano, Matelica, Corinaldo), as well as some more high-profile sights, such as the ducal palaces of Gubbio and Urbino, not far away. There’s great walking in the Gola della Rossa-Frassino national park nearby for the energetic, but Borgo Tranquillo would be a good place just to chill as well. It entirely lives up to its name.

Staying in the Villa at Borgo Tranquillo

The Accommodation – fantastic, clean and modern with just the right touch of traditional Italian lifestyle, beautifully presented, spacious and welcoming. Well stocked with the right equipment.
The Pool – the best pool we have ever used! The owners have thoughfully prepared and equipped the pool area to ensure complete enjoyment and relaxation! The club house leading to the pool is a particular highlight of this property. Sauna, Hammam, stunning views and refreshments all day – delightful.
The People – welcoming, helpful, convivial and discreet hosts. They provided the most complete and accurate information before and during the stay. Highly professional and approachable with any concerns or questions.
The area – peaceful and unspoilt. Adriatic only 40 minutes by car. The coastal town of Senigallia has hidden treasures – just the right mix of history and modernity, stylish shopping and cafe’s.
As a family on holiday in Italy we are more familiar with Tuscany. Our holiday at Borgo Tranquillo has shown us that Le Marche, although an altogether different region, has many attractions, striking scenery and unspoilt appeal. We would thoroughly recommend the area and Borgo Tranquillo to our friends.

A wonderful place!

Hofesh & Helen, London, August 2008

Borgo Tranquillo – an amazing place!

Had an amazing time here, from being greeted with a glass of prosecco from the lovely owners, to the infinity pool with the mind blowing view, to all the little details which made everything just right. Everything had been thought of – big italian cook book, DVD library, well equipped kitchen, free bar, books, bikes and BBQs to borrow, comfy pool cushions, board games, sauna, bath in bedroom, cool wet room bathroom, funky chairs suspended from the ceiling. It was all amazing. the place is very well designed – it looks like a funky boutique hotel, but self-catering (which we prefer). The location is quiet and the view is outstanding. We didn’t venture out very much but are nice little towns nearby to pick up provisions. Would highly recommend this place!
Sarah & Joe London, July 2008

Traditional AND Contemporary – Fabulous!

Rent a holiday cottage or apartment deep into rural Italy and you kind of know what to expect. If you’re after slightly shabby Italian countryside vernacular, a chintz curtain covering the dented saucepans under the sink, wobbly dark wooden furniture and hand-me-down crockery then the Borgo is NOT for you. The Borgo is cool. The Borgo is stylish. The Borgo is many other things too …..quiet, charming, spacious, clean, well appointed and the very best of traditional & modern combined.
The location is spectacular nestling on top of a rolling hill overlooking a beautiful fields and valleys. The Borgo is close to the reasonably sized traditional hill town of Arcevia and just 40 minutes drive from Senigallia on the Adriatic coast – which we just loved – seriously good restaurants & bars, lots of sand and a fabulous old fish market which has been beautifully refurbished. Good shopping & cafes too along with a mix of traditional and modern shops and there’s even a castle and an excellent street market (ask Frank or Ariane which day its on – they couldn’t be more helpful) – that’s if you can drag yourself away from the gorgeous infinty pool with it’s view over the valley (…and if you get a wet day or two there’s always the sauna and the hammam!)
If you like out-and-about however and have done the many local walks then head for the caves at Frasassi – its not that far and a lovely drive. ‘Caves’ – hmmmm… I bet you’re thinking some drippy-ceilinged grot hole with coloured fairy lights – think again! OK – so you do have to drive past the actual cave entrance down to the car park & souvenir shops and then get a shuttle bus back up – and you do have a short walk through a tunnel in the side of the mountain to access the caves – but I guarantee that’s not what you’ll remember when you leave! Breathtaking – we explored for over one and a half hours – not to be missed, never forgotten. Great family destination – even our two teenagers loved it.
Back to the Borgo – light fresh contemporary interiors with lovely furniture all mod cons – and each apartment has outside areas to just sit and enjoy. We really loved this place and will definitely be going back this summer – I doubt Le Marche has a better rural retreat – I can almost taste the Rosso Conero just thinking about it……
Ketts, Tunbridge Wells, Spring 2008

Tranquillo holiday getaway

What a wonderful stay we had over the new year period. Coming home each evening after exloring the beautiful region of marche was a delight. We didn’t want to leave our villa on the hill, it became our home. The accomodation is supurb, the facilites fantastic, the hosts friendly and helpful. The perfect tranquill holiday getway.
Lloyd family, Brisbane, Easter 2008

Restoration

We purchased Borgo Tranquillo in July 2003. Finally in April 2005 all planning permissions were in hand and building works could commence. Easter 2008 our first guests arrived at Borgo Tranquillo.

Where We Are
Click to find out more

Where We Are

Le Marche, is often described as one of Italy’s best kept secret, once you have visited you will understand why. The region offers spectacular mountainous scenery, a beautiful climate, long unspoilt beaches and the best in traditional Italian cooking and hospitality.

Le Marche’s picturesque villages are full of ancient Churches, Abbeys and Monasteries, all beautifully preserved over the years.

Le Marche is not overcrowded, with only 1.5 million people living in the province with the majority along the coast. Arcevia is situated 35 km inland from the costal resort of Senigallia, which boast some of the longest sand beaches in Italy. Situated in the foothills of the Appennines the town boasts clean healthy air and a mild climate. From the town and the neighbouring hills you can admire the splendid panoramic view of the Appennines and the Adriatic coast.

Borgo Tranquillo is only 40 minutes from Ancona Airport, just five minutes outside the beautiful hill town of Arcevia with local banks, bars, supermarkets, butchers, bakers, newsagents, pharmacies and restaurants.

Local information:

Detailed Information on local cuisine, wineries, restaurant, shopping, walking, sightseeing etc can be found in our guide ‘Discover Le Marche with Borgo Tranquillo’ which will be emailed to our guests one month before arrival.

For additional regional information please visit www.arceviaweb.itwww.turismo.marche.it
